alert.note: Alert for Gunnison (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued August 05 at 4:10PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY HEALTH ADVISORY FOR WILDFIRE SMOKE FROM 900 AM SATURDAY UNTIL 900 AM SUNDAY... The Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment has issued the following... WHAT...Air Quality Health Advisory for Wildfire Smoke. WHERE...central Gunnison County. Locations include, but are not limited to Gunnison. WHEN...900 AM Saturday August 05 to 900 AM Sunday August 06 IMPACTS...Air Quality Health Advisory for Wildfire Smoke Issued for central Gunnison County Issued at 8:00 AM MDT, Saturday, August 5, 2023 Issued by the Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment Affected Area: central Gunnison County. Locations include, but are not limited to, Gunnison. Advisory in Effect: 8:00 AM MDT, Saturday, August 5, 2023 to 9:00 AM MDT, Sunday, August 6, 2023. Public Health Recommendations: If smoke is thick or becomes thick in your neighborhood you may want to remain indoors. This is especially true for those with heart disease, respiratory illnesses, the very young, and the elderly. Consider limiting outdoor activity when moderate to heavy smoke is present. Consider relocating temporarily if smoke is present indoors and is making you ill. If visibility is less than 5 miles in smoke in your neighborhood, smoke has reached levels that are unhealthy. Outlook: The Lowline wildfire is located in central Gunnison County approximately 10 miles southwest of Crested Butte and 14 miles northwest of Gunnison. Moderate to heavy smoke is possible early Saturday morning from the fire, southward along County Road 730 to Gunnison. Smoke in these areas should decrease by late Saturday morning as atmospheric mixing increases. By Saturday afternoon, smoke will likely be transported east and northeast of the fire. Most of that smoke will remain aloft and well above ground level, however brief periods of moderate to heavy smoke will be possible across eastern Gunnison County, including Crested Butte. Late Saturday night and into Sunday morning, smoke could again get heavy as it drains eastward towards County Road 730 and southward into Gunnison. HEALTH INFORMATION...Public Health Recommendations: If smoke is thick or becomes thick in your neighborhood you may want to remain indoors. This is especially true for those with heart disease, respiratory illnesses, the very young, and the elderly. Consider limiting outdoor activity when moderate to heavy smoke is present. Consider relocating temporarily if smoke is present indoors and is making you ill. If visibility is less than 5 miles in smoke in your neighborhood, smoke has reached levels that are unhealthy.
